intro: Psychotria assimilis, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is known for containing alkaloids, including cocaine, which has significant pharmacological and cultural importance. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also classified as a controlled substance in many countries.
